LiDAR SLAM.2509.13972:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.13541:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.13536:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.14949:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.16019:
|2025-09-19|SLaM-DiMM: Shared Latent Modeling for Diffusion Based Missing Modality Synthesis in MRI|Bhavesh Sandbhor等|[2509.16019](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.16019)|无|◆ Brain MRI scans are often found in four modalities, consisting of T1-weighted with and without contrast enhancement (T1ce and T1w), T2-weighted imaging (T2w), and Flair.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.15673:
|2025-09-19|Omni-LIVO: Robust RGB-Colored Multi-Camera Visual-Inertial-LiDAR Odometry via Photometric Migration and ESIKF Fusion|Yinong Cao等|[2509.15673](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.15673)|无|◆ Wide field-of-view (FoV) LiDAR sensors provide dense geometry across large environments, but most existing LiDAR-inertial-visual odometry (LIVO) systems rely on a single camera, leading to limited spatial coverage and degraded robustness.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.17864:
|2025-09-22|ProDyG: Progressive Dynamic Scene Reconstruction via Gaussian Splatting from Monocular Videos|Shi Chen等|[2509.17864](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.17864)|无|◆ Achieving truly practical dynamic 3D reconstruction requires online operation, global pose and map consistency, detailed appearance modeling, and the flexibility to handle both RGB and RGB-D inputs.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.16909:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.16863:

Dufera等|[2509.16863](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.16863)|无|◆ We introduce ConfidentSplat, a novel 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS)-based SLAM system for robust, highfidelity RGB-only reconstruction.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.18954:
|2025-09-23|Towards Robust LiDAR Localization: Deep Learning-based Uncertainty Estimation|Minoo Dolatabadi等|[2509.18954](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.18954)|无|◆ LiDAR-based localization and SLAM often rely on iterative matching algorithms, particularly the Iterative Closest Point (ICP) algorithm, to align sensor data with pre-existing maps or previous scans.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.18342:
|2025-09-22|Semantic-Aware Particle Filter for Reliable Vineyard Robot Localisation|Rajitha de Silva等|[2509.18342](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.18342)|无|◆ Accurate localisation is critical for mobile robots in structured outdoor environments, yet LiDAR-based methods often fail in vineyards due to repetitive row geometry and perceptual aliasing.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.20171:
|2025-09-24|Optical Ocean Recipes: Creating Realistic Datasets to Facilitate Underwater Vision Research|Patricia Schöntag等|[2509.20171](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.20171)|无|◆ The development and evaluation of machine vision in underwater environments remains challenging, often relying on trial-and-error-based testing tailored to specific applications.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.19522:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.19463:
|2025-09-23|CU-Multi: A Dataset for Multi-Robot Collaborative Perception|Doncey Albin等|[2509.19463](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.19463)|无|◆ A central challenge for multi-robot systems is fusing independently gathered perception data into a unified representation.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.21006:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.20757:
|2025-09-25|MASt3R-Fusion: Integrating Feed-Forward Visual Model with IMU, GNSS for High-Functionality SLAM|Yuxuan Zhou等|[2509.20757](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.20757)|无|◆ Visual SLAM is a cornerstone technique in robotics, autonomous driving and extended reality (XR), yet classical systems often struggle with low-texture environments, scale ambiguity, and degraded performance under challenging visual conditions.

LiDAR SLAM.2509.20739:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.22288:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.22058:

LiDAR SLAM.2509.21602:
|2025-09-25|Real-Time Indoor Object SLAM with LLM-Enhanced Priors|Yang Jiao等|[2509.21602](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.21602)|无|◆ Object-level Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM), which incorporates semantic information for high-level scene understanding, faces challenges of under-constrained optimization due to sparse observations.

Visual SLAM.2507.15716:
|2025-07-21|DiffPF: Differentiable Particle Filtering with Generative Sampling via Conditional Diffusion Models|Ziyu Wan等|[2507.15716](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2507.15716)|无|◆ DiffPF首次将条件扩散模型融入粒子滤波框架，实现了高质量的后验采样，克服了传统方法的局限性。

◆ 在真实世界任务（如KITTI视觉里程计）中，DiffPF相比现有最优可微分滤波器实现了26%的精度提升，验证了其实际应用价值。  
◆ DiffPF的创新性在于将生成式采样与粒子滤波结合，为动态系统状态估计提供了更高效的解决方案。|
Visual SLAM.2507.15496:

实验证明该方法在KITTI数据集上达到或超越了当前最优视觉和LiDAR里程计的精度与鲁棒性。|
Visual SLAM.2507.13145:
|2025-07-17|DINO-VO: A Feature-based Visual Odometry Leveraging a Visual Foundation Model|Maulana Bisyir Azhari等|[2507.13145](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2507.13145)|无|◆ 提出DINO-VO系统，首次将视觉基础模型DINOv2的稀疏特征匹配能力应用于单目视觉里程计任务，解决了传统学习型VO在鲁棒性和泛化性上的不足。

Visual SLAM.2507.07903:

Visual SLAM.2507.07752:
|2025-07-10|IRAF-SLAM: An Illumination-Robust and Adaptive Feature-Culling Front-End for Visual SLAM in Challenging Environments|Thanh Nguyen Canh等|[2507.07752](http://arxiv.org/pdf/2507.07752)|无|IRAF-SLAM论文的核心贡献是通过自适应前端设计提升视觉SLAM在复杂光照环境下的鲁棒性，主要创新点如下：

◆ 在TUM-VI和EuRoC数据集上的实验表明，该方法显著减少跟踪失败并提升轨迹精度，优于现有vSLAM方法。

◆ 实现计算高效的自适应前端策略，在不显著增加计算负担的前提下提升系统鲁棒性。

◆ 公开了算法实现代码，促进相关研究发展。|
Visual SLAM.2507.18886:

Visual SLAM.2507.00243:
